rationale:
Choice C is correct. An equation that defines a linear function f can be written in the form fx=mx+b, where m represents the slope and b represents the y-intercept, 0,b, of the line of y=fx in the xy-plane. The function fx=-5x+30 is linear. Therefore, the graph of the given function y=fx in the xy-plane has a y-intercept of 0,30. It’s given that fx gives the approximate volume, in fluid ounces, of juice Caleb had remaining after making x popsicles. It follows that the y-intercept of 0,30 means that Caleb had approximately 30 fluid ounces of juice remaining after making 0 popsicles. In other words, Caleb had approximately 30 fluid ounces of juice when he began to make the popsicles.

Choice A is incorrect. This is an interpretation of the slope, rather than the y-intercept, of the graph of y=fx in the xy-plane.

Choice B is incorrect and may result from conceptual errors.

Choice D is incorrect and may result from conceptual errors.
stem: Caleb used juice to make popsicles. The function fx=-5x+30 approximates the volume, in fluid ounces, of juice Caleb had remaining after making x popsicles. Which statement is the best interpretation of the y-intercept of the graph of y=fx in the xy-plane in this context?

answerOptions.content: Caleb used approximately 5 fluid ounces of juice for each popsicle.
Caleb had approximately 5 fluid ounces of juice when he began to make the popsicles.
Caleb had approximately 30 fluid ounces of juice when he began to make the popsicles.
Caleb used approximately 30 fluid ounces of juice for each popsicle.
